events.message: The policyholder reported a car accident involving their vehicle hitting a guardrail on the highway. Initial details were provided for the claim record.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after reviewing the description of the collision with another vehicle on the city street.
An insurance agent was assigned promptly to manage the policyholder's case and assist with the next steps of the claim process.
The insurance company acknowledged receipt of the auto accident claim and assured the customer that help would be provided soon.
To proceed with the claim, the agent requested the customer to submit photos of the damaged vehicle and the official police accident report.
The customer submitted all required documentation including the police report, photos of the collision damage, and repair estimates.
The investigation team began a review of the submitted documents and started contacting relevant parties to verify the details of the accident.
The investigation was completed confirming the policyholder's vehicle was damaged through a collision caused by another driver’s negligence.
A settlement amount was proposed based on the repair costs and liability determination, aiming for prompt resolution of the claim.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and appreciated the timely communication throughout the claim process.
The claim was officially approved by the insurance underwriter after final review and acceptance of the settlement terms.
The settlement payment was issued to the policyholder’s account for vehicle repair costs as agreed upon in the approved claim.
The auto accident claim was officially closed after confirmation that payment was received and the customer’s vehicle repair was underway.
All records and documentation related to the auto accident claim were archived following the closure of the case for future reference.
